result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Odell Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to contact Probation Agent by end of business July 25, 2022

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with J.W., A.S., or E.M. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:15 PM Defendant Aaron Odell Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Aaron Odell Wright. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Count 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 2 & 3 - DRI. Statement by the DE. Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation. Defendant to contact probation agent by end of business on July 25, 2022. Conditions: 92 days WC Jail. 92 days CFTS. Time served sentence. Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with J.W., A.S., or E.M. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 11:47 AM Defendant Aaron Odell Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Aaron Odell Wright. Deputy Scott Schaut sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by ADA Ryan. Witness identifies Defendant in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Zamzow. Witness excused @ 11:58 AM. The Court finds probable cause exists. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. DE stands mute to all charges. NG Plea entered as to all matters. Atty Zamzow requests to be heard on the issue of bond modification. Bond argument by Atty Zamzow. Statement by ADA Ryan regarding warrant status in other jurisdictions. The Court respectfully declines bond modification.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:55 pm.
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 02:55 pm.
